results.title: Young voices of Maffra = Future leaders : Young voices of Maffra
results.brief_description:
This film focuses on the young people of Maffra. Eight students from Maffra Secondary College were interviewed, representing all the year levels, and asked to talk about life in a regional town, their hopes for the future and issues that affect them and their world.
The end result is a portrait of young rural Victorians who are thoughtful and engaging, with concerns about the environment, world politics and the survival of small towns.

results.title: Young voices from the Arab world: the lives and times of five teenagers [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Leslie Nucho and Amideast, Washington, DC
results.brief_description: Five teenagers from various parts of the Arab world share their lives, experiences and hope for the future, providing an insight into everyday aspects of Arab culture and society. Their narratives and different locales reveal a place of contrasts, but also one of similarities in the shared cultural heritage, attitude towards family and religion, continuity and change. Fourteen-year-old Muhammad from Jordan explains how Islam guides his life, in particular the period of Ramadan and the haj. Fourteen-year-old Tamara from Beirut talks about the reconstruction of her city and her aspiration to be an archaeologist. Twelve-year-old Hazem lives in Egypt with his geologist parents and talks of the enjoyment he derives from movies and spending time with friends. Twelve-year-old Sa’ud lives with his extended family in Kuwait and has been told of many of the traditional ways, in danger of disappearing, by his grandmother. Twelve-year-old Khadija from Morocco talks about the differences between her generation and that of her mother. General information is also provided on the demographics, geography, religion, language, trade, industry, family and identity of the Arab world. A detailed teacher’s guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Young Philly
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Phillip is a 20-year-old Hip Hop artist from Mildura who won the prestigious Noel Tovey Achievement Award in 2010 (for Emerging Artist). Despite having a difficult start in life, Phil is intent on living a positive life and breaking the negative stereotypes associated with young Aboriginal people. He shares his passion for rapping with a desire to become a youth worker in the hopes of one day establishing a youth centre for Indigenous kids in Mildura.

results.title: Young man with a horn
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Jerry Wald and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Kirk Douglas plays the talented trumpeter, Rick Martin, loosely based on the life of jazz great, Bix Beiderbecke. Rick is a poor white orphan who learns the power of jazz through scouting the black neighbourhoods of his city. He comes in contact with a trumpet player (the brilliant jazz trumpeter Hoagy Carmichael) who teaches him how to play. His genius for the trumpet leads Rick to gigs with all-white orchestras and combos but he aches to play the sensual jazz music he adores. His battle between the demands for material success and his love for music leads him to alcoholism and a life on the streets. Co-starring Lauren Bacall as the rich society woman who Rick marries and who betrays him and Doris Day as the one woman who really understands his love for jazz. “Young Man With a Horn” features some fantastic black and white camerawork on New York locations and a great jazz and popular music score, including the songs “With A Song in My Heart”, “Get Happy” and “Love for Sale”. Based on the novel by Dorothy Baker.

results.title: Young job seekers package (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Consists of six programmes designed to help young people in the search for work. The program also provides comments from the employers point of view re each applicant. No other credits available.

results.title: Young job seekers package
results.brief_description: Consists of six programmes designed to help young people in the search for work. The segments are titled as follows:- Your first job interview, Preparation, Presentation, Answering questions, Showing initiative, and Improving performance. The program also provides comments from the employers point of view re each applicant. No other credits available.

results.title: Young Hands
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, John Appleton and W.H. Shepard
results.brief_description:
Essentially an adverisement for the Juniour Farmer’s Organisation, focusing on how members and the community benefit from it. Stars ‘Hal’, a young man who must continue to run his family’s farm while his father is ill.

Follows Hal and other junior farmers members as they complete various ‘projects’ such as raising lambs, preserving fruit and growing crops. Strong social element within the organisation is exemplified by a social dance that is used to bookend Hal’s story.

Very earnest piece. Amusing end scene.

results.title: Young hands
results.creator_credit: W. H. Shepherd, John Martin-Jones, Australian National Film Board and Dept of the Interior
results.brief_description: Depicts the activities of Young Farmers Clubs in Australia. Two students from Pakistan and Indonesia, visit the club meeting, learn the aims of the club and see how the group functions.
